detailed_results.title: Excelsoft Technologies IPO Day 2: Subscription soars to 4.3x; check GMP, strengthens & key highlights
detailed_results.content_text: Excelsoft Technologies’ Rs 500-crore IPO continued to draw strong interest on its second day, with the issue subscribed 4.3 times so far. Investors have bid for 13.18 crore shares against the 3.07 crore shares on offer. The three-day subscription window will remain open until November 21.In the grey market, the GMP has inched up to 12.9%, compared with 11.8% earlier. With a premium of Rs 15.5 over the issue price of Rs 120, the stock is indicating a potential listing range of Rs 135–136.The IPO comprises a fresh issue of 1.50 crore shares worth Rs 180 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 2.67 crore shares totalling Rs 320 crore.Excelsoft Technologies IPO subscription statusOverall subscription stood at 4.3 times as of 1:40 pm on Day 2.Retail Individual Investors (RIIs) subscribed 4.39 times, bidding for 1.53 crore shares. Retail buyers showed strong interest, bidding for nearly twice the number of shares reserved for them.Non-Institutional Investors (NIIs) subscribed a robust 9.75 times for 65.78 lakh sharesHigh-net-worth investors and other non-institutional participants were even more enthusiastic, applying for nearly two and a half times their allotted quota.Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) subscribed to 4% of their 87.71 lakh share quota.Institutional investors, however, remained largely inactive on Day 1, with only a small fraction of their reserved shares being bid for.Excelsoft Technologies IPO GMP todayThe grey market premium currently stands at Rs 15.5, or 12.9% above the issue price. This suggests that the stock could list around Rs 135–136, reflecting upbeat market sentiment ahead of its official debut.Excelsoft Technologies IPO detailsExcelsoft Technologies has launched a Rs 500 crore IPO, comprising a fresh issue of 1.50 crore shares worth Rs 180 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 2.67 crore shares totaling Rs 320 crore.The price band is set at Rs 114–120 per share, and the lot size is 125 shares. At the upper end of the band, the IPO implies a market capitalisation of around Rs 1,381 crore. The shares have a face value of Rs 10 each and are proposed to list on both the BSE and NSE. The allocation split is 50% for QIBs, 35% for retail investors, and 15% for non-institutional investors.About the companyExcelsoft Technologies is a vertical SaaS company operating in the global learning and assessment ecosystem. Its offerings include AI-driven learning tools, assessment and testing platforms, online proctoring solutions, learning experience platforms, student success tools, and digital eBook products.Key products include SARAS e-Assessments, EasyProctor, SARAS Learning Solutions, OpenPage, EnablED, CollegeSparc, and LearnActiv. The company caters to around 76 clients worldwide, including major players like the Pearson Group, and derives a large portion of its revenue from long-term, recurring contracts.The funds from the fresh issue will be directed towards expansion initiatives. This includes capex for a new property in Mysore—covering land acquisition and construction—along with upgrades to electrical systems, investments in software, hardware, and network infrastructure, and general corporate purposes.Financial performanceExcelsoft has demonstrated strong financial momentum. Its restated consolidated total income increased to Rs 233.29 crore in FY25, up from Rs 198.30 crore in FY24 and Rs 195.10 crore in FY23. Net profit rose sharply to Rs 34.69 crore in FY25, compared with Rs 12.75 crore in FY24 and Rs 22.41 crore in FY23, signaling a significant recovery in profitability.The company reported an EBITDA margin of 31.40% in FY25, versus 27.72% in FY24 and 34.94% in FY23. Its net worth stood at Rs 371.29 crore in FY25, and return on capital employed (RoCE) was 16.11%.Risk factorsExcelsoft is heavily dependent on the Pearson Education Group, which contributes about 59% of its revenue, creating a meaningful client concentration risk.Global operations expose it to multiple regulatory and compliance regimes, while the SaaS business model can delay revenue recognition and affect short-term cash flows. The company also operates in a space where cybersecurity and data protection are critical, given the sensitive nature of education and assessment data.Should you subscribe?From a valuation perspective, the IPO appears expensive. Based on the FY25 earnings per share of ₹3.47, the issue is priced at approximately 34.62 times its pre-IPO earnings—a level that sits on the higher side compared with the valuation multiples of listed technology and IT services peers mentioned in the note.Although the company operates in a specialised and fast-growing vertical SaaS segment and maintains strong, long-term global client relationships, a P/E ratio close to 35 offers limited comfort for investors who prioritize a substantial margin of safety at the time of listing.As Swastika Investmart noted, “The issue seems aggressively priced (P/E of 35), prompting a neutral outlook with expectations of only modest listing

risk_analysis.summary: Excelsoft Technologies’ Rs 500-crore IPO continued to draw strong interest on its second day, with the issue subscribed 4. Investors have bid for 13. 18 crore shares against the 3. 07 crore shares on offer.
risk_analysis.reasoning: The tone is neutral and involves financial, regulatory concerns and with keywords: revenue, profit, earnings.

detailed_results.title: IRS Stimulus Check November 2025: Is a $2,000 Trump stimulus check really coming in November - or are IRS payment rumors false?
detailed_results.content_text: IRS Stimulus Check November 2025: IRS has issued no update about any new stimulus check for November, yet rumors have continued to spread across social media as comments from President Donald Trump and various state rebate programs create confusion among Americans. There are no federal relief payments scheduled for the rest of 2025. The speculation intensified after Trump again mentioned tariff-funded rebate checks. He previously suggested payments of $1,000 to $2,000 and even floated figures up to $5,000 earlier in July alongside former DOGE chief Elon Musk, according to Axios. None of these ideas became formal legislation. Congress has not introduced or approved any stimulus bill. The IRS has also not prepared any new rollout. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said he has not discussed stimulus checks with the president and noted that the administration’s tax agenda—such as no tax on tips, overtime, or Social Security—may offer relief instead. The last real stimulus-related payment available to Americans was the $1,400 Recovery Rebate Credit tied to the 2021 pandemic package. The final deadline to claim it was April 15, 2025. No new program has been announced since. The IRS warns that stimulus misinformation has triggered a new wave of scams. Fraudsters misuse the term “stimulus check” and attempt to steal banking information, Social Security numbers, and refunds. The IRS never sends messages through social media. It never texts taxpayers without consent. It never calls to demand payments, threaten arrest, or promise fast refunds. The agency stresses that any real stimulus would require Congressional approval, a signed law, and an official IRS announcement. None of these steps have occurred. As of mid-November 2025, there are no IRS payments, no pending stimulus bills, and no federal rebate checks coming this year. The circulating November stimulus rumors remain false.No IRS Stimulus Check Is Scheduled for November 2025Searches for “IRS stimulus check November 2025” have exploded. Viral posts claim new payments worth $1,390, $1,702, or $2,000 are arriving through direct deposit.But the IRS has not announced any new stimulus or federal relief payments for 2025 or 2026.The IRS newsroom for November lists only routine tax updates. Its Economic Impact Payment page is now marked historical, confirming that all COVID-era stimulus checks ended with the 2021 Recovery Rebate Credit.Major U.S. outlets are consistent on this point. Reports note that no federal stimulus checks are approved for the rest of 2025, and no IRS program is running any national direct deposit relief payments.Any post promising a surprise “IRS stimulus arriving this week” has no official basis.Why $1,390, $1,702 and $2,000 Went Viral OnlineThe dollar amounts circulating on TikTok, YouTube, and Facebook come from a mix of real programs and false claims.The $1,702 number usually traces back to Alaska’s 2024–2025 Permanent Fund Dividend, which is only for Alaska residents. It is not a national IRS payment.The $1,390 figure appears in widely reported scam posts. Consumer alerts in multiple states have flagged fake messages using this amount to lure people into sharing personal details.The $2,000 figure comes from a political proposal, not a live federal program. None of these amounts represent an active IRS direct deposit stimulus check in November 2025.If a message links to a sign-up page or asks for bank login details, it is not legitimate.Trump’s $2,000 Tariff Dividend: A Real Proposal, Not an IRS Payment YetPresident Donald Trump has promoted a $2,000 “tariff dividend” plan. He claims revenue from global tariffs could be paid out to millions of Americans.The White House says Trump is committed to exploring this design. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has floated income limits similar to past stimulus.But the plan is not law. Congress must approve funding and authorize the IRS to distribute payments.Budget analysts say current tariff revenue is far too small to cover broad $2,000 payments.A Supreme Court review of the tariffs adds even more uncertainty.For now, the tariff dividend remains a proposal, not a real IRS stimulus check.DOGE Checks and the DOGE Dividend Are Policy Ideas, Not Active PaymentsPosts about “DOGE checks” or a “DOGE dividend” continue to spread online. These refer to the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) and a proposal that some savings could be paid to taxpayers.The concept has generated attention, especially after high-profile endorsements.However, DOGE has not launched any payment system. Independent reviews show that documented savings fall far short of what would be required for nationwide payouts.No DOGE payments are scheduled for November 2025, and no IRS infrastructure exists for such checks.How to Avoid 2025 IRS Stimulus ScamsScams are rising as fake posts imitate IRS branding. The IRS warns that it never initiates stimulus or refund contact through text, email, or social media.Fraud attempts often use urg

risk_analysis.summary: IRS Stimulus Check November 2025: IRS has issued no update about any new stimulus check for November, yet rumors have continued to spread across social media as comments from President Donald Trump and various state rebate programs create confusion among Americans. There are no federal relief payments scheduled for the rest of 2025. The speculation intensified after Trump again mentioned tariff-funded rebate checks. He previously suggested payments of $1,000 to $2,000 and even floated figures up

detailed_results.title: JP Power share price rally nearly 30% in two days after Adani Group wins creditor nod for JP Associates acquisition
detailed_results.content_text: Shares of Jaiprakash Power Ventures (JP Power) surged 11.75% to Rs 22.63 on Thursday, extending the previous day’s sharp 15% rise as investor sentiment improved following a major breakthrough in the Jaypee Group’s insolvency proceedings. In the last two trading sessions, JP Power shares have rallied nearly 30%.The rally comes after the Gautam Adani-led Adani Group secured approval from the Committee of Creditors (CoC) to acquire Jaiprakash Associates Ltd., the debt-ridden infrastructure and industrial conglomerate undergoing insolvency resolution.According to a regulatory filing made on Wednesday, Adani Enterprises confirmed that the creditors voted in favour of its resolution plan. The company stated it received a Letter of Intent (LoI) from the Resolution Professional on November 19, 2025.The deal is worth nearly $1.5 billion, Bloomberg reported, citing people in the know. ET could not independently verify this amount. ReadThe implementation of the resolution plan may be undertaken by Adani Enterprises, entities within its promoter group, other Adani Group companies, or through a special purpose vehicle, depending on the final structure approved under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code.Jaiprakash Associates, the flagship of the Jaypee Group, operates across multiple sectors, including engineering and construction, cement, power, real estate, fertilisers, and hospitality. The acquisition marks another significant expansion move by the Adani Group and is expected to reshape the landscape for several of these sectors.Market participants are viewing the development as a potential breakthrough for both the Jaypee Group’s ongoing insolvency process and for JP Power’s near-term outlook, fueling continued investor enthusiasm in the stock.On the technical front, the Daily RSI (14) for Jaiprakash Power Ventures stands at 74.9, which places it in the overbought zone, as readings above 70 typically indicate heightened buying pressure. This suggests the stock may be due for a near-term pullback or consolidation.Also read: Groww shares fall 18% in 2 days. What’s triggering the fall in Billionbrains?Additionally, the stock is currently trading above all eight of its key Simple Moving Averages (SMAs), reflecting strong upward momentum. This alignment of moving averages is generally viewed as a bullish technical signal, reinforcing the stock’s prevailing positive trend.(Disclaimer: Recommendations, suggestions, views and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of Economic Times)

risk_analysis.summary: Shares of Jaiprakash Power Ventures (JP Power) surged 11. 63 on Thursday, extending the previous day’s sharp 15% rise as investor sentiment improved following a major breakthrough in the Jaypee Group’s insolvency proceedings. In the last two trading sessions, JP Power shares have rallied nearly 30%. The rally comes after the Gautam Adani-led Adani Group secured approval from the Committee of Creditors (CoC) to acquire Jaiprakash Associates Ltd.
risk_analysis.reasoning: The tone is positive and involves financial, regulatory concerns and with keywords: share price, ban.

detailed_results.title: Tenneco Clean Air Share Price: Tenneco Clean Air makes strong entry, lists at 27% premium over IPO price; shares up 2% post listing in afternoon trade - The Economic Times
detailed_results.content_text: 09:17:45 AM IST, 19 Nov 2025Tenneco Clean Air Share Price Live: ValuationOn the valuation front, based on annualized FY26 earnings, Tenneco Clean Air India is seeking a P/E of 23.8 times, with a Mcap-to-Sales ratio of 3.2 times, implying a post-issue market capitalization of around ₹1,60,231 million. This suggests that the IPO is fairly priced. The company’s strong market leadership in clean air and advanced automotive components, combined with rising demand for SUVs and premium vehicles, a strategically diversified product portfolio, long-standing OEM partnerships, and access to global R&D, positions Tenneco well to tap into both domestic growth and export opportunities. Given these strengths, we recommend a ‘Subscribe for Long Term Only’ rating for the issue.

detailed_results.title: Wild ride with Billionbrains! 3 reasons why Groww shares are seeing such sharp price swings
detailed_results.content_text: Billionbrains (Groww) stock has been on a roller-coaster since listing, rising sharply in the first few sessions and then hitting a lower circuit. Much of this movement is driven by a combination of strong post-listing demand, extremely low free float and rich valuations that make the stock more sensitive to any change in sentiment. Together, these factors have created a setup where even small orders can significantly impact the price.Strong post listing demandThe first trigger came from heavy buying after listing. Investors chased the stock as soon as it debuted, leading to a steep rise in the first few sessions. Prashanth Tapse of Mehta Equities said the early up move reflected strong demand and a rush of traders trying to enter the counter.He added that investors were also giving Groww a high multiple because of its market share and strong user growth. "So the rally is a mix of short-term technical factors and long-term business expectations," he said.Also Read: Inside the short-selling trap of Groww's near multibagger surge: What happened and what it means for investors?Extreme low free floatThe second factor is Groww's extremely low free float. Only around 7% of the company’s shares are currently available for trading, while almost 93% remain locked in with IPO investors. With so few shares actually circulating in the market, demand easily overwhelms supply.In such stocks, even small buying orders can push the price sharply higher because there simply aren’t enough sellers. This also creates the conditions for shorts to get squeezed, which happened with Groww in earlier sessions.Traders who sold shares without owning them were unable to buy them back when the stock began rising, which forced them to cover at higher prices and added to the volatility.Valuation storyThe third factor is the valuation story. Groww's market cap has crossed Rs 1.15 lakh crore at one point, far above the implied valuation of about Rs 61,000 crore at IPO pricing. Some analysts believe this stretch in valuation is adding to selling pressure currently.Vipul Bhowar of Waterfield Advisors said the company is receiving "tech-style valuations" because of its rapid user growth, but he warned that the broking business is cyclical and sensitive to market activity.When markets slow, broking revenues can fall just as fast. He also pointed out that the industry is highly competitive and tightly regulated, making very high multiples hard to justify for long periods.Also read: Worried about an AI stock bubble? That might be good news for Nifty bullsPut together, these three elements -- strong initial demand, very low free float and premium valuations -- have turned Groww into one of the most volatile newly listed stocks. As long as the float remains tight and investor appetite remains high, price swings may continue. The stock is currently trading in a zone where fundamentals, sentiment and technical factors are all pulling at the same time, making the ride bumpy for traders and investors alike.(Disclaimer: Recommendations, suggestions, views and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of Economic Times)

risk_analysis.summary: Billionbrains (Groww) stock has been on a roller-coaster since listing, rising sharply in the first few sessions and then hitting a lower circuit. Much of this movement is driven by a combination of strong post-listing demand, extremely low free float and rich valuations that make the stock more sensitive to any change in sentiment. Together, these factors have created a setup where even small orders can significantly impact the price. Strong post listing demandThe first trigger came from heavy

detailed_results.title: Cloudflare stock falls after network outage affects millions of users across X, ChatGPT
detailed_results.content_text: Cloudflare outage on November 18, 2025, caused major disruptions across the internet. Millions of users could not access services like X, ChatGPT, Spotify, Uber, and even popular gaming platforms. The problem began early Tuesday morning, around 6:20 a.m. ET, after the company detected a sudden surge in unusual traffic. This triggered internal system errors, affecting a massive chunk of global web traffic.By the peak, outage-monitoring sites recorded nearly 5,000 user reports. The number dropped to around 600 by 8 a.m. ET as some services started to recover. A fix was deployed around 9:42 a.m. ET, gradually restoring stability. Cloudflare confirmed that no customer data was compromised, and there is no evidence of a cyberattack.Shares of Cloudflare fell roughly 3% in morning trading following the outage. Investors reacted to concerns about operational reliability. Cloudflare handles over 20% of all web traffic globally, making any downtime highly visible and impactful. Outages like this highlight the risks of centralized web infrastructure and how dependent businesses and users are on a few major providers.The incident caused widespread inconvenience. Users reported login failures, errors, and slow access across multiple services. Streaming platforms, social media apps, transit services, and gaming networks all faced temporary interruptions. The outage showed how even a short disruption in infrastructure can ripple through industries, affecting millions of people within minutes.Cloudflare acted quickly to stabilize its systems. Services began returning to normal by mid-morning, though some users experienced lingering errors. Transparency will be key in regaining client and investor trust. Clear communication about the root cause, remediation steps, and improved fail-safe mechanisms can help restore confidence.The Cloudflare outage comes shortly after other major internet infrastructure disruptions. Past events at Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure have shown that reliability and trust are essential in the web infrastructure industry. Each outage reinforces the need for robust monitoring, redundancy, and contingency planning.For investors, short-term caution is expected until confidence returns. Medium-term impacts could include slower growth, increased client scrutiny, or margin pressure from investments in resilience. For users, the event is a stark reminder that the internet’s smooth functioning depends on a few critical providers.Why did Cloudflare’s outage affect so many services?Cloudflare plays a key role in global internet traffic, handling more than 20% of all websites. Its network connects countless apps and services, from social media to streaming platforms and gaming. When a major disruption occurs, the effects are felt far and wide.The scale of the outage shows how centralized web infrastructure can amplify problems. A single point of failure in such systems can impact multiple services at once. Many organizations rely heavily on Cloudflare for performance, security, and uptime. As a result, even a short disruption can trigger widespread user frustration and operational slowdowns.For businesses, these interruptions can have financial and reputational consequences. Users may abandon apps or platforms during downtime, and companies may incur costs to resolve issues or compensate affected customers.Investors also pay close attention. Stock prices can react quickly to operational problems in critical infrastructure companies, reflecting concerns about reliability, customer trust, and potential revenue impacts.How did the stock market react to the Cloudflare outage?Cloudflare’s shares fell by around 3% in morning trading on the day of the outage. The drop highlights investor sensitivity to operational reliability in internet infrastructure companies.Market watchers note that outages in major infrastructure providers can trigger broader concern. Investors worry about customer churn, contractual penalties, and potential costs for improving systems to prevent future failures. In sectors like cybersecurity and content delivery, trust and uptime are critical. Even a temporary disruption can weigh heavily on sentiment.Analysts suggest that confidence may remain cautious until Cloudflare provides a clear explanation of the root cause and reassurances about improved safeguards. For companies relying on Cloudflare, the event may prompt them to explore backup solutions, multiple vendors, or revised contracts to reduce dependency risks.What caused the Cloudflare outage and how was it fixed?Cloudflare reported that the outage was triggered by a sudden surge in traffic, which caused internal errors and system degradation. This “internal service disruption” affected several services simultaneously, including AI platforms, social networks, and gaming systems.The company acted quickly to stabilize its network. A fix was deployed around 9:42 a.m. ET, after which most services gradually returned to normal. By late

Millions of users could not access services like X, ChatGPT, Spotify, Uber, and even popular gaming platforms. The problem began early Tuesday morning, around 6:20 a. ET, after the company detected a sudden surge in unusual traffic.

detailed_results.title: Budget 2025 Highlights: NPS Vatsalya contribution to get tax benefit up to Rs 50,000
detailed_results.content_text: Budget 2025 Highlights: In a big boost to the Indian middle class, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday announced that there will be no income tax payable for incomes up to Rs 12 lakh, and Rs 12.75 lakh for salaried taxpayers (including standard deduction) in the new tax regime.Here's a look at new tax slabs;Income up to Rs 4 lakh (per annum) ----- Nil Between Rs 4 and 8 lakh ---------------- 5 per cent (tax) Between Rs 8 and 12 lakh --------------- 10 per cent Between Rs 12 and 16 lakh -------------- 15 per centBetween Rs16 and 20 lakh --------------- 20 per cent Between Rs 20 and 24 lakh -------------- 25 per cent Above Rs 24 lakh ------------------------- 30 per centNil tax slab will apply for annual income up to Rs 12 lakh (Rs 12.75 lakh for salaried tax payers with standard deduction of Rs 75,000) under new tax regime.Here's a summary of all the major Budget announcements;Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has put the middle class squarely at the centre of her Budget by announcing nil income tax up to Rs 12 lakh income. Her previous budgets were marked by huge amounts of money marked for capital expenditure aimed at building infrastructure such as railways and highways. In this budget, Sitharaman has decided to raise capital expenditure at a lower rate. The capital expenditure for 2025-26 will be 11.2 lakh crore, marginally higher from Rs 11.1 lakh crore in the previous budget when she had raised it by 11%, slowing down the breathtaking speed in previous years. Known for her prudent budgeting, she has stayed the course on fiscal deficit by announcing it to be 4.4% for next financial year when it was expected to be below 4.5%. Sitharaman has also not taken her attention off the Viksit Bharat roadmap as she has detailed plans to rejuvenate several critical sectors such as agriculture and small industry, calling them engines of development. She has also laid emphasis on human capacity enhancement and skilling as well as outlining a reformist agenda for several sectors. These steps aim at powering economic growth in the long run. Sitharaman's Budget is high on hope when consumer demand is low, inflation has hit the common people, and GDP growth has slumped while concerns over job creation persist.This Budget comes as GDP growth is projected to fall to a four-year low of 6.4% in FY24, near its decadal average. The Economic Survey forecasts 6.3-6.8% growth in FY26, well below the pace required to achieve Viksit Bharat by 2047. It stresses the need for land and labour reforms to drive growth.With India's world-leading growth showing signs of moderation, the push for an 8% annual growth rate remains crucial. The projected growth for FY25-26 compares to an estimated 6.4% in FY24 and 8.2% in FY23-24.Budget 2025 Live streaming: When and where to watch Nirmala Sitharaman’s speech;Budget Speech Timing: Scheduled for 11 a.m. on February 1 in the Lok Sabha.Live Broadcast: Available on Sansad TV, DD News, and Sansad TV’s YouTube channel.Online Updates: Follow all Budget 2025 updates on economictimes.comKey numbers to watch out for in the Union Budget for 2025-26:Fiscal DeficitCapital ExpenditureDebt RoadmapBorrowingTax RevenueGSTNominal GDPDividendDisinvestment & Asset MonetisationBudget FAQsWhat is the Union Budget?The Union Budget is the annual financial statement of the government. It outlines revenue and expenditure for the upcoming financial year.Who presents the Union Budget?Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presents the Budget in Parliament.When is the Budget presented?The Budget is presented on February 1.What are the key components of the Budget?Revenue Budget Expenditure Budget Fiscal DeficitGDP Growth Projections Policy AnnouncementsWill there be changes in income tax slabs?Given the pressure on middle class, Nirmala Sitharaman may propose changes in tax slabs, exemptions, and deductions under the old and new tax regimes in the budget.What are the indirect tax changes?Major indirect taxes are GST, customs, excise duties etc. The Budget can alter GST rates, impose or reduce customs and excise duties, impacting imported goods and services.

detailed_results.title: Nifty 50 Live | NSE Nifty 50 Index Today
detailed_results.content_text: The Nifty is the flagship benchmark of the National Stock Exchange (NSE), which is a well-diversified index, comprising top 50 companies in terms of free-float market capitalisation that are traded on the bourse.Officially called the Nifty 50, the index is computed using the free float market capitalisation method, which is essentially the count of shares in active circulation in the market at any given point of time.The Nifty, just like BSE benchmark Sensex, is today used for benchmarking portfolios and returns of mutual fund schemes and launching index funds.The Nifty index was launched on April 22, 1996, with a base value of 1,000 counted from November 3, 1995. Live Nifty quotes are available on nseIndia.com, ETMarkets.com and numerous other web platforms and TV channels at any point of time.The Nifty 50 is owned and managed by NSE Indices Limited (formerly known as India Index Services & Products Limited-IISL), a specialized company focused on an index as a core product.The review of Nifty 50 is undertaken semi-annually based on data for six months ending January and July. The replacement of stocks in Nifty 50 (if any) is implemented from the last trading day of March and September. In case of any replacement in the index, a four weeks' prior notice is given to the market participants.Additional index reconstitution may be undertaken in case any of the index constituent undergoes merger, demerger, delisting, specific cases of capital restructuring etc., in case any of the index constituent is moved to BZ series, if trading permission of any of the index constituent is withdrawn from F&O segment, if a security is suspended for trading from Capital Market for any reason and in case of any adverse regulatory findings or orders issued against any of the index constituent that necessitates removal of such stock from the index.In case of a capital restructuring or voluntary delisting, equity shareholders' approval is considered as a trigger to initiate the replacement of such stock from the index through additional index reconstitution. For all other cases, replacements will be initiated based on notifications issued by the Exchange. Further, additional index reconstitution may be undertaken to screen for continued eligibility of an index constituent that may have undergone corporate action involving demerger in accordance with the guidelines prescribed under a separate section 'Corporate actions involving demerger/ spin-off' of this document.There are defined eligibility criteria for selection of Nifty constituent stocks. The liquidity of a stock is measured by the market impact cost, which is essentially the cost involved in transacting a stock. For a stock to qualify for inclusion in the Nifty50, it must have traded at an average impact cost of 0.50 per cent or less for six months and for 90 per cent of observation cases. The constituents should have derivative contracts available on NSE.Disclaimer: This report is authored by an external party. The views expressed in the report are that of the respective authors/ entities and do not represent the views of Economic Times (ET). ET does not guarantee, vouch for or endorse any of its contents nor is responsible for them in any manner whatsoever. The content, views and insights are provided for informational purposes only and should not be construed as investment advice. Please take all steps necessary to ascertain that any information and content provided is correct, updated and verified. ET hereby disclaims any and all warranties relating to the report and any content therein. Users have no license or right to copy, modify or distribute the content without the permission of the original owner.

detailed_results.title: Lenovo announces multiple AI projects at tech world India 2025 event
detailed_results.content_text: Lenovo has announced multiple artificial intelligence (AI)-powered projects at its annual Tech World India 2025 event. The Chinese PC maker announced advancements in AI-driven manufacturing, research and development, and enterprise solutions aimed at accelerating digital infrastructure and enterprise adoption. With this move, Lenovo aims to use AI to drive growth and innovation in the country, which it claims to be one of its most strategic markets.Lenovo introduced multiple AI projects at the Tech World India event to highlight India's growing role as an AI hub. The event featured presentations of intelligent devices, transparent displays, fan-led creative workshops, and gaming competitions, providing varied experiences for attendees.During the Lenovo Faststart segment, AI solutions were showcased that are designed to support Indian businesses and enhance the country’s sporting initiatives. Participants also had the opportunity to explore new features, including Lenovo AI Now, which improves computing performance in real time. On-stage discussions addressed collaborative AI development, with industry leaders talking about responsible AI practices, sustainability, and the upcoming AI PCs specifically designed for Indian users. The event also examined AI’s contribution to education, sustainability, and the development of emerging engineering talent.At the event, Shailendra Katyal, managing director at Lenovo India said: “We have been at the forefront of the AI revolution India is witnessing today, with the first-in-industry AI devices and solutions launched in the market. Lenovo’s AI vision in India is reflected in its 71% year-on-year revenue growth in the first three quarters of FY 2024-25. With Made in India devices touching a new high of Rs 18 thousand crores through CY2024, we are bullish about our continued momentum in the market and are excited about collaborating with our partners and customers to unleash the true power of what AI can do. As Lenovo completes 20 years of presence in India, we have renewed our commitment to deliver powerful, flexible, and responsible AI solutions that empower individuals and drive meaningful change across communities.” Published On Mar 7, 2025 at 03:30 PM IST Join the community of 2M+ industry professionals. Subscribe to Newsletter to get latest insights & analysis in your inbox. All about ETCIO industry right on your smartphone!

This expenditure is critical to ensure continuity of operations and maintain a strong presence in high-demand cities.Investment in Subsidiaries: The company intends to invest ₹47.17 crore to support South Indian growth through its subsidiary, Xylem Learning, and ₹28 crore to strengthen Utkarsh Classes’ offline footprint, enhancing their overall market reach.Technology and Infrastructure (₹200.11 crore): Funds in this segment will be allocated to upgrading server and cloud infrastructure, which is crucial to accommodate millions of additional students online and improve digital learning capabilities.Marketing and Brand Building (₹710 crore): A substantial portion of the proceeds will go toward marketing initiatives, brand awareness campaigns, and nationwide expansion efforts to attract and retain students.Increasing Stake in Utkarsh Classes (₹26.5 crore): The company plans to increase its ownership in Utkarsh Classes, enabling better control, integration, and alignment of strategies with the parent company.New Acquisitions and General Purposes: The remaining funds will be reserved for strategic acquisitions and general operational requirements, supporting overall growth and flexibility.

detailed_results.title: Saalumarada Thimmakka passes away at 114, Padma Shri Awardee leaves behind a legacy of 385 Banyan trees
detailed_results.content_text: Padma Shri awardee and renowned environmentalist Saalumarada Thimmakka passed away at a private hospital in Bengaluru on Friday. The 114-year-old had been unwell for some time and was undergoing treatment when she breathed her last, her family sources said. Born on June 30, 1911, Thimmakka earned the title Saalumarada after planting 385 banyan trees along a 4.5-km stretch between Hulikal and Kudur in Ramanagara district. With no formal education, she began planting and nurturing the trees, treating them as her children to cope with the void of being childless. Thimmakka received 12 major awards for her work, including the Padma Shri in 2019, the Nadoja Award from Hampi University in 2010, the National Citizen Award in 1995 and the Indira Priyadarshini Vrikshamitra Award in 1997.Tributes from Karnataka CM and Environment ministerKarnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah posted his on X, saying he was “deeply saddened” by the news. He said Timmakka, who planted thousands of trees and nurtured them like her own children, had dedicated most of her life to environmental conservation. He added that her love for nature had made her “immortal” and that the region had become poorer with her demise. “My salutations to the departed great soul. I pray that the departed soul attains eternal peace. My condolences to their family,” he said.Karnataka environment minister Eshwar Khandre visited Apollo Hospital in Jayanagar to pay his respects. He said the Padma Shri awardee, who nurtured trees like her own children, was a “living embodiment of love for the environment.” He added that her selfless service, simplicity and affection would remain an “eternal inspiration.”(With inputs from PTI)

detailed_results.title: A top-tier device crafted for vertical retro handheld enthusiasts, AYANEO Pocket VERT makes its debut
detailed_results.content_text: On November 18, 2025, AYANEO hosted a new product showcase, presenting the AYANEO Pocket VERT for the first time. Designed for vertical retro handheld enthusiasts, this top-tier device was revealed live by AYANEO CEO Arthur, highlighting its exceptional design, exquisite craftsmanship, and powerful performance. Whether you are a fan of retro handhelds or a modern gamer seeking high performance, the Pocket VERT offers an experience that ignites passion and exceeds expectations. AYANEO’s mission: delivering the purest handheld gaming experience for true gamers As a pioneer in the handheld gaming industry, AYANEO has always upheld the philosophy of “Real Gamers, Know Gamers,” continuously exploring how to deliver the purest handheld gaming experiences. From Windows to Android handhelds, from horizontal to vertical designs, every innovation stems from deep understanding of player needs and long-term commitment. AYANEO & KONKR: a dual-brand strategy In July 2025, AYANEO officially launched its new sub-brand, KONKR. While AYANEO focuses on high-end premium products, KONKR emphasizes high performance and value. Under this dual-brand strategy, AYANEO’s ecosystem has become richer, offering players more personalized choices. The Pocket VERT represents AYANEO’s latest premium vertical handheld offering. Continuous evolution in Android handhelds: from Pocket S to Pocket DMG AYANEO has consistently surprised players in the Android handheld market. The Pocket S, the first high-end Android handheld from AYANEO, set the industry benchmark with its craftsmanship and flagship-level performance. Subsequent models, including the Pocket S2, expanded the ecosystem further. In the vertical handheld segment, the Pocket DMG brought the nostalgic charm of classic devices to modern handhelds, catering to retro enthusiasts. Pursuit of excellence: achieving Pocket S-level quality in a vertical format For years, gamers have hoped for a vertical handheld that matches the high-end feel and comprehensive experience of the Pocket S series. Tackling the challenge of transforming this experience into a vertical form, AYANEO has reimagined what a premium vertical Android handheld can be. The Pocket VERT answers this ambition, delivering an even more refined and ultimate vertical experience. AYANEO Pocket VERT: the ultimate dream device for vertical retro handheld enthusiasts The debut of Pocket VERT marks a new height in vertical handheld aesthetics and experience. It is more than a gaming device—it is a collectible masterpiece that embodies retro nostalgia, design aesthetics, and artistic dedication. Exquisite aesthetics: an art-level handheld in minimalist form Continuing AYANEO’s minimalist design language, the Pocket VERT uses pure lines, balanced proportions, and precise structures to create a unified and sophisticated visual order. Every detail is crafted to artistic standards, making the device feel like a playable sculpture. Compact and refined, it measures 86.4mm × 143mm × 20.5mm, ,and combines premium feel with extreme portability. Craftsmanship breakthrough: a never-before-seen combination of techniques The Pocket VERT employs full-body CNC precision carving instead of traditional stamping. Multiple passes ensure every surface, chamfer, and cutout achieves perfect consistency. As the first handheld brand to introduce a unified glass panel, AYANEO has further advanced this technique in the Pocket VERT. The front glass panel seamlessly connects with the body, creating smooth, natural transitions. The result is a clean, transparent visual, precise touch response, and a strong sense of unity and futuristic design. The ultimate screen for retro enthusiasts The screen is always the centerpiece of any handheld experience. Pocket VERT features a 3.5" LTPS high-resolution display—long a dream for retro gamers—offering 1600×1440 resolution, 615 PPI, 10× GB point-to-point pixel accuracy, and 450 nits full-screen brightness. From retro classics to modern mobile games, it delivers crystal-clear visuals, arguably the sharpest display on any Android handheld. Artistic expression in color aesthetics As a trendsetter in handheld color design, AYANEO offers a new artistic palette for the Pocket VERT。 Midnight Black – deep and steady, reflecting the golden era of classic handhelds Moon White – pure and elegant, soft and refined like moonlight Lava Red – vibrant and intense, full of craftsmanship and artistic passion Seamless, umarked button design Building on the acclaimed umarked button design of the Pocket S, the Pocket VERT pushes aesthetics further with a full umarked button layout. Every button blends seamlessly with the overall design, achieving a perfect union of minimalist beauty and practical functionality. Crystal-textured buttons: elegant, durable, and precise Crafted from transparent crystal-like material, the buttons catch and refract light, creating a unique handheld light-and-shadow aesthetic. Smooth to the touch with crisp feedback, e

detailed_results.title: PM Modi meets Indian-origin tech entrepreneurs in Johannesburg ahead of G20
detailed_results.content_text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday (local time) had a "fruitful interaction" with Indian-origin tech entrepreneurs in Johannesburg, discussing their work across multiple sectors and encouraging closer engagement with India. During the meeting, the Prime Minister spoke about initiatives undertaken by entrepreneurs in FinTech, social media platforms, agriculture, education, healthcare, medical devices and other fields. "Had a fruitful interaction with Indian origin tech entrepreneurs in Johannesburg. They talked about the work they are doing in sectors such as FinTech, social media platforms, agriculture, education, healthcare, medical devices and more. Called upon them to deepen their engagement with India and work closely with our people," PM Modi wrote on 'X'. Show more Show less

During the meeting, the Prime Minister spoke about initiatives undertaken by entrepreneurs in FinTech, social media platforms, agriculture, education, healthcare, medical devices and other fields. detailed_results.title: Alexa+ launches in Canada, the first country to get the next generation of Alexa outside the US
detailed_results.content_text: For example, while cooking in the kitchen, you can ask, “Alexa, play my favourite artist,” and Alexa+ will start playing it on your nearby Echo Show. As you move to the living room, just say, “Alexa, move the music here” and it continues seamlessly. You can also say, “Alexa, play CBC News everywhere,” to fill your home with sound, or “Alexa, show me the front door,” to check your Ring camera and see if that package made it through the snowstorm.

graphs_images.image_alt: Woman in kitchen looking at Alexa+ smart display showing recipes and meal planning
New Alexa+ interface on large display with multiple widgets

detailed_results.title: Google Terms of Service - Privacy & Terms - Google
detailed_results.content_text: Your relationship with GoogleThese terms help define the relationship between you and Google. When we speak of “Google,” “we,” “us,” and “our,” we mean Google LLC and its affiliates, excluding any local entities based in India. Broadly speaking, we give you permission to access and use our services if you agree to follow these terms, which reflect how Google’s business works and how we earn money.What you can expect from usProvide a broad range of useful servicesWe provide a broad range of services that are subject to these terms, including:apps and sites (like Search and Maps)platforms (like Google Shopping)integrated services (like Maps embedded in other companies’ apps or sites)devices (like Google Nest and Pixel)Many of these services also include content that you can stream or interact with.Our services are designed to work together, making it easier for you to move from one activity to the next. For example, if your Calendar event includes an address, you can click on that address and Maps can show you how to get there.Develop, improve, and update Google servicesWe’re constantly developing new technologies and features to improve our services. For example, we use artificial intelligence and machine learning to provide you with simultaneous translations, and to better detect and block spam and malware. As part of this continual improvement, we sometimes add or remove features and functionalities, increase or decrease limits to our services, and start offering new services or stop offering old ones. When a service requires or includes downloadable or preloaded software, that software sometimes updates automatically on your device once a new version or feature is available. Some services let you adjust your automatic update settings.If we make material changes that negatively impact your use of our services or if we stop offering a service, we’ll provide you with reasonable advance notice, except in urgent situations such as preventing abuse, responding to legal requirements, or addressing security and operability issues. We’ll also provide you with an opportunity to export your content from your Google Account using Google Takeout, subject to applicable law and policies.What we expect from youFollow these terms and service-specific additional termsThe permission we give you to access and use our services continues as long as you comply with:We also make various policies, help centers, and other resources available to you to answer common questions and to set expectations about using our services. These resources include our Privacy Policy, Copyright Help Center, Safety Center, Transparency Center, and other pages accessible from our policies site. Finally, we may provide specific instructions and warnings within our services – such as dialog boxes that alert you to important information.Although we give you permission to use our services, we retain any intellectual property rights we have in the services.Respect othersWe want to maintain a respectful environment for everyone, which means you must follow these basic rules of conduct:comply with applicable laws, including export control, sanctions, money laundering, and human trafficking lawsrespect the rights of others, including privacy and intellectual property rightsdon’t abuse or harm others or yourself (or threaten or encourage such abuse or harm) including against children — for example, by misleading, defrauding, illegally impersonating, defaming, bullying, harassing, or stalking others; hosting or publishing any obscene content; or inciting the violation of applicable lawsOur service-specific additional terms and policies, such as our Generative AI Prohibited Use Policy, provide additional details about appropriate conduct that everyone using those services must follow. If you find that others aren’t following these rules, many of our services allow you to report abuse. If we act on a report of abuse, we also provide the process described in the Taking action in case of problems section.Don’t abuse our servicesMost people who access or use our services understand the general rules that keep the internet safe and open. Unfortunately, a small number of people don’t respect those rules, so we’re describing them here to protect our services and users from abuse. In that spirit:You must not abuse, harm, interfere with, or disrupt our services or systems — for example, by:introducing malwarespamming, hacking, or bypassing our systems or protective measuresjailbreaking, adversarial prompting, or prompt injection, except as part of our safety and bug testing programsaccessing or using our services or content in fraudulent or deceptive ways, such as:phishingcreating fake accounts or content, including fake reviewsmisleading others into thinking that generative AI content was created by a humanproviding services that appear to originate from you (or someone else) when they actually originate from usproviding services that appear to originate from us when t

detailed_results.title: User Agreement | LinkedIn
detailed_results.content_text: By creating a LinkedIn account or accessing or using our Services (described below), you are agreeing to enter into a legally binding contract with LinkedIn (even if you are using third party credentials or using our Services on behalf of a company). If you do not agree to this contract (“Contract” or “User Agreement”), do not create an account or access or otherwise use any of our Services. If you wish to terminate this Contract at any time, you can do so by closing your account and no longer accessing or using our Services.As a Visitor or Member of our Services, the collection, use, and sharing of your personal data is subject to our Privacy Policy, our Cookie Policy and other documents referenced in our Privacy Policy, and updates. You acknowledge and have read our Privacy Policy. ServicesThis Contract applies to LinkedIn.com, LinkedIn-branded apps, and other LinkedIn-related sites, apps, communications, and other services that state that they are offered under this Contract (“Services”), including the offsite collection of data for those Services, such as via our ads and the “Apply with LinkedIn” and “Share with LinkedIn” plugins.LinkedIn and other Key TermsYou are entering into this Contract with LinkedIn (also referred to as “we” and “us”).Designated Countries. We use the term “Designated Countries” to refer to countries in the European Union (EU), European Economic Area (EEA), and Switzerland.If you reside in the “Designated Countries”, you are entering into this Contract with LinkedIn Ireland Unlimited Company (“LinkedIn Ireland”) and LinkedIn Ireland will be the controller of your personal data provided to, or collected by or for, or processed in connection with our Services.If you reside outside of the “Designated Countries”, you are entering into this Contract with LinkedIn Corporation (“LinkedIn Corp.”) and LinkedIn Corp. will be the controller of (or business responsible for) your personal data provided to, or collected by or for, or processed in connection with our Services.Affiliates. Affiliates are companies controlling, controlled by or under common control with us, including, for example, LinkedIn Ireland, LinkedIn Corporation, LinkedIn Singapore and Microsoft Corporation or any of its subsidiaries (e.g., Github, Inc.).Social Action. Actions that members take on our services such as likes, comments, follows, sharing content. Content. Content includes, for example, feed posts, feedback, comments, profiles, articles (and contributions), group posts, job postings, messages (including InMails), videos, photos, audio, and/or PDFs. 1.2 Members and Visitors
